relation: Each campus has a cafeteria. The food is good, but terribly overpriced for both quality and serving size.

The teachers teach down to the lowest person in the class. Even if there is a pre-req for the course, you will often not cover what you should in the class because the instructor will spend too much time backtracking over stuff students are expected to already know.

I would not recommend this school to anyone that has not struggled their way through high school. The teachers teach really far down and tuition is incredibly overpriced for what you get out of it. Support staff are uncaring.
pageTitle: Eastern Florida State College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {220818=Do your research! Don't just jump into something thinking it will be fun. I did that right out of high school, I graduated in 2006. Now I'm still going to college. Be sure to take your time, there's no rush!, 573545=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 473147=Eastern Florida State is a very safe campus. I have been attending since 2004 and have never come across any issues. The security team really keeps up with what needs to be done., 392949=Brevard Community College is a great school. The science department taught by Dr. James Yount is especially great. I attend the Titusville campus and will be attending the Cocoa campus in the fall of 2013. I am consistently surprised at the quality that this school provides. I am grateful to call it MY school.}

textAfterTable: Great for these types of students Who is ready to learn Tips for prospective students Great college for the first milestone Login to rate or flag the reviews Kaleyann from Satellite Beach, FL 07/14/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 2 out of 2 people found this review useful. 3 of 147 Categories Comments Great for these types of students BCC is great for students that are still trying to figure out what they want to do with their life. I was on the fence my ehole high school career, and BCC really helped me pinpoint what I love to do, and what I'm best at, which is Writing. Tips for prospective students Apply as soon as you can! It is important to meet with an advisor so that he or she can get you on the right track. Be sure to only take on what you can handle. I started out with only taking 4 classes and now I'm ready to take on
